definition: resolute person/person with aspirations/people who feel/people who use their heads
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
containing_words.word: 世上無難事，只怕有心人

definition: lit. nothing is difficult on this earth, if your mind is set (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
containing_words.word: 天下無難事，只怕有心人

sentences.english: But sincere or insincere, the intentions of persons are not here under question.
sentences.chinese: 但不管是真誠還是虛僞，有心人不必在兒這盤根究底。

sentences.english: Got your mind set on a dream.
sentences.chinese: 夢想可成真，只怕有心人。

sentences.english: Where there is, as long as caring people.
sentences.chinese: 天下無難事，只要有心人。

sentences.english: A good man has a heart.
sentences.chinese: 總之，好男人是一位有心人。

sentences.english: Nothing in the world is difficult for one who sets his mind on it.
sentences.chinese: 世上無難事，只怕有心人。

sentences.english: The Chinese people believe there is nothing in the world that cannot be done for those who are really resolved.
sentences.chinese: 中國人相信“世上無難事，只怕有心人”。

sentences.english: I am a man of heart.
Every job provides unique opportunities for the employee who looks for them.
sentences.chinese: 每一工作崗位都會爲有心人提供獨一無二的機會。

sentences.english: The teacher told us that nothing is difficult if we put our hearts into it.
sentences.chinese: 老師告訴我們世上無難事，只怕有心人。

definition: to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue
to have a mind to/to intend to/deliberately/considerate
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
other people/bystanders/onlookers/outsiders
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to leak (of information, liquid etc)/to divulge
eyes and ears/sb's attention or notice/information/knowledge/spies
to suspect/to have misgivings/suspicious/misgivings
in the dark/in secret/on the sly/surreptitiously
to push the wave and add to the billows (idiom); to add momentum/to encourage sth to get bigger/to add fuel to the fire
secret agent/detective
(of news) to spread/to get around
